docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Documentation and Resources

Demos

Web demos for ASR, MT and TTS have been developed for public usage. Using these existing endpoints, the Speech-to-Speech and Video-to-Video demos have been built.

API Reference

API access information elaborating on utilizing the models deployed by the lab. Requests from python and cURL are well supported.

Documentation

Documentation of various topics ranging from installation of frequently used frameworks to detail on implementing research paper findings.

Models

Details of the several models developed and being built, along with the download access to the same.

Data Access

Access to data collected and hosted by Speech Lab, IITM.

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: Details on API request and response protocols for the ASR, MT, TTS and Video Interpolation services have been provided here.

docs.title: ASR (Speech-to-Text)
docs.text: The endpoint for ASR service is https://asr.iitm.ac.in/asr/v2/decode

docs.title: Request keys
docs.text: Key Description file the media file to be transcribed language the language of the source audio/video in all lowercase (eg: hindi, english) vtt (optional) whether a webVTT caption file has to be generated. This is an optional value. It accepts two string values either true or false. By default, this is false. This can be used for captioning purposes.

docs.title: Response keys
docs.text:
Upon successful service of the request, the API returns a JSON response with the following keys:

Key Description status success time_taken time taken to transcribe the given audio/video in seconds transcript the transcription of the given speech input, as infered by the deployed model vtt WebVTT caption if it was requested. i.e, if the vtt key was set to true in the request, a WebVTT caption would be returned.

In case of a service failure, the API returns a JSON response with the following keys:

Key Description status failure reason a reason for the failure in serving the request

docs.title: Supported Languages
docs.text:
• English
  • Gujarati
  • Hindi
  • Kannada
  • Marathi
  • Tamil
  • Telugu

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
PythoncURL 
import requests
files = {
'file': open('speech_sample1.mp3', 'rb'),
'language': (None, 'hindi'),
'vtt': (None, 'true'),
}
response = requests.post('https://asr.iitm.ac.in/asr/v2/decode', files=files)
print(response.json())

curl -v -X POST -F 'file=@speech_sample2.wav' -F 'language=english' \
-F 'vtt=true' https://asr.iitm.ac.in/asr/v2/decode

Sample audio files to test the API: english speech, tamil speech.

The ASR API accepts media files from most of the common formats such as .mp3, .mp4, .wav, .ogg etc.

Web Demo interface available at https://asr.iitm.ac.in/asr/v2

docs.title: MT (Text-to-Text)
docs.text: The endpoint for the Machine Translation service is https://asr.iitm.ac.in/test1/translate. This API supports the translation services translation services provided by research groups at IITB, IIIT-H and Meta AI. While we internally host the NLLB model from Meta AI, the translations from IITB / IIIT-H are obtained through internal API calls to their systems.

docs.title: Request keys
docs.text: Key Description src_language source language of the text to be translated in lowercase (eg: hindi, telugu). Default option: english. tgt_language target language to which the input data is to be translated into. all in lowercase (eg: sanskrit, urdu). Default option: english. transcript (optional) source text being passed for translation. source_vtt (optional) data being passed for translation as a string, but with captions as in a .vtt file. Each segment/caption of the vtt is translated independently. translator_choice the translator option being chosen to translate the input. Choose from iiit-h, iitb, meta_ai. Default option: meta_ai.

docs.title: Response keys
docs.text:
Upon successful service of the request, the API returns a JSON response with the following keys:

Key Description status success mt_out If the transcript key is passed with some text in the request, mt_out would carry the translation of the same. translated_vtt If the source_vtt key is passed with vtt content in the request, translated_vtt would carry the translation of each of the captions in the source_vtt and returns the translated vtt content. transcript If the transcript key is passed with some text in the request, additional punctuations would have been incorporated into the text and the richer text is returned. source_vtt If the source_vtt key is passed with vtt content in the request, additional punctuations would have been added to each of the captions in the source_vtt and the richer source vtt content is returned.

In case of a service failure, the API returns a JSON response with the following keys:

Key Description status failure reason a reason for the failure in serving the request

docs.title: Language pairs supported by meta_ai
docs.text:
Every possible set of language pairs from the below set is supported by the meta_ai translator choice. 

{'English', 'Hindi', 'Assamese', 'Awadhi', 'Bengali', 'Bhojpuri', 'Gujarati', 
'Chattisgarhi', 'Kannada', 'Kashmiri', 'Malayalam', 'Maithili', 'Marathi', 
'Odia', 'Punjabi', 'Sanskrit', 'Urdu', 'Telugu', 'Tamil', 'Arabic'}

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
PythoncURL 
import requests
text = "सुप्रभात. आईआईटी मद्रास में आपका स्वागत है। "
payload = {
'src_language': 'hindi',
'tgt_language': 'english',
'transcript': text,
'source_vtt': None,
'translator_choice': 'meta_ai'
}
response = requests.post('https://asr.iitm.ac.in/test1/translate', data = payload).json()
print(response)

curl -v -X POST -F 'src_language=english' -F 'tgt_language=telugu' \
-F 'transcript=Welcome to our lab' -F 'translator_choice=iiit-h' \
https://asr.iitm.ac.in/test1/translate

Web Demo interface for the NLLB model is available at https://asr.iitm.ac.in/test4
